etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in The Epinal Glossary. Perhaps from the same Germanic base as Old Norwegian ampa to impose (Norwegian (Nynorsk) ampa to vex, to bother), itself probably a variant of the base of Old Icelandic ama, Faroese ama, Norwegian (Nynorsk) ama, perhaps from the same Indo-European base as Sanskrit amīvā misery

definitions: A swelling on the skin, especially a boil, pustule, or pimple; a rash.
